journals.title: Dr. Thaddeus Crane's Diary
journals.format: Leather-bound daily diary with gold-embossed initials
journals.reveals: Full confession of the poisoning, Alice's threat, her murder, his guilt, and the cover-up. Documents the entire crime.

journals.title: Dr. Thaddeus Crane's Patient Notes
journals.format: Bound ledger book with alphabetical patient tabs
journals.subject: Alice Whitmore - consultation notes
journals.reveals: His sessions with Alice, the affair, emotional connection, her psychic abilities, her concerns about Cordelia.

journals.title: Sebastian's Alchemical Notebooks
journals.format: Multiple worn leather notebooks with handwritten formulas and sketches throughout
journals.reveals: Original HARMLESS formula for the Elixir of Eternal Love. Shows all ingredients were non-lethal. Proves Sebastian was innocent and Thaddeus corrupted it.

journals.title: Antidote Research Notes
journals.format: Scattered loose sheets and fragments, hastily written, ink-stained and water-damaged
journals.reveals: Dr. Thaddeus's desperate attempts to save Sebastian after realizing his brother drank the poisoned elixir. Shows guilt and panic.

journals.title: Professor Hartley's Consultation Notes
journals.format: Formal typed pages on university letterhead, organized with botanical references
journals.subject: Botanical consultations with Sebastian Crane
journals.reveals: Sebastian consulted about non-lethal plants and botanicals. His formula ingredients were legitimate and harmless.

journals.title: Silas Blackwell's Private Notes
journals.format: Private journal entries in small leather notebook, personal shorthand and coded observations
journals.reveals: Detailed observations of discrepancies in all three bodies that contradict official records. Documents suspicious patterns.

journals.title: Cordelia's Diary
journals.format: Ornate leather journal with silk ribbon bookmark, elegant handwriting on cream pages
journals.reveals: Mentions discovering the affair between Dr. Thaddeus and Alice. Documents her threat to expose him. Details her morning tea ritual with Sebastian (the poisoned elixir). Contains the rose bread recipe that connects to Eleanor Sullivan.

journals.title: Eleanor Sullivan's Diary - The Baker
journals.location: With Baker character (Eleanor Sullivan's personal archives)
journals.reveals: Eleanor's discovery of her adoption and her birth mother's identity as Cordelia Montrose. Documents the three photographs sent by the Sullivans, Eleanor finding a newspaper clipping about Cordelia's engagement, and learning of Cordelia's death in 1925. Most crucially, reveals how Elias Monroe delivered the rose bread recipe to Eleanor after Cordelia's deathâ€”the bridge connecting the Dressmaker and Baker characters. Shows Eleanor's emotional journey from security to self-understanding and her commitment to honoring her mother's memory through the rose bread legacy.

journals.title: Elias Monroe's Work Notes & Scattered Poems
journals.type: Personal Journal - Work Notes and Poetry
journals.format: Scattered handwritten pages - work measurements, unsent poems, recipe notes, professional observations
journals.written_by: Elias Monroe (Dressmaker and unrequited lover of Cordelia)
journals.reveals: Elias's unsent love poems for Cordelia, measurements and notes for her wedding dress, and crucially - Cordelia's rose bread recipe that she entrusted to him to pass to Eleanor. Shows Elias knew Cordelia would not survive to wear the dress. Connects the Dressmaker descendant to the Baker through the shared recipe and Eleanor's identity as Cordelia's daughter.

journals.title: Leather-Bound Journal - Frankie's Secret Ledger
journals.format: Water-damaged leather-bound journal with Italian name embossed on cover, coded entries and sketch pages
journals.location: Hidden behind loose brick in mansion fireplace
journals.reveals: Water-damaged leather journal with Italian name inscribed inside, filled with coded entries and sketches. Frankie Romano's personal accounts showing wealth estimates, asset locations, and dates. Code suggests locations: 'Garden 1928' (buried?), 'Painted Lady 1935' (art), 'Deep Water 1940s' (ocean?). Entries stop abruptly in 1962 - same year IRS investigation began. Suggests Frankie moved assets to hide them before seizure.

journals.title: Handwritten Letter - 'To Vincent, When You're Ready'
journals.format: Single handwritten letter on aged cream paper, sealed in wax, enclosed in formal envelope
journals.location: Sealed envelope in Art Collector's desk drawer
journals.reveals: Aged letter in Italian handwriting with poetic language and cryptic references to 'the garden,' 'paintings we love,' and 'where the boats sleep.' Letter from Frankie Romano to his nephew 'Vincent' (Andy Romano's real name) written in 1963, before his death. Contains poetic clues: 'our fortune rests where we watched the sunset' (sunset = west), 'paintings are safer than accounts,' 'the boats know our secrets' (harbor?). Suggests Frankie entrusted location knowledge to next generation. Andy may not realize the letter contains a treasure map in metaphor.

journals.title: Long Beach Urban Legends & Mysteries - Podcast Series
journals.format: Episode scripts, research notes, audio transcripts, and compiled mystery files
journals.reveals: Collection of documented mysteries from Long Beach spanning decades. Includes research on the 1925 mysterious deaths, the Sullivan bakery fire, the Romano family treasure legend, and other unsolved cases. The Influencer's skeptical analysis juxtaposed with actual clues creates a document that both obscures and reveals the truth about these interconnected mysteries.

journals.title: Letter from Margaret Montrose (Cordelia's Mother)
journals.format: Handwritten letter on Montrose family stationery
journals.location: With Dressmaker character (found among Elias Monroe's possessions / Cordelia's hidden papers)
journals.reveals: Harsh letter from Cordelia's mother regarding the adoption arrangement for Eleanor. Emphasizes family reputation and discretion. Shows maternal coldness and prioritization of social standing over Cordelia's emotional wellbeing. Proves the adoption was arranged by the Montrose family, not the Sullivans. Indicates Cordelia was sent away specifically to hide the pregnancy and birth.
